memberdef.name: INSERT_KEY
memberdef.initializer:
do { \ g_hash_table_insert(specials, g_strdup(k), g_strdup(code)); \
gnt_keys_add_combination(code); \ } while (0)

memberdef.name: INSERT_COMB

detaileddescription.para: The key-bindings will be saved in a tree. When a keystroke happens, GNT will find the sequence that matches a binding and return the length. A sequence should not be a prefix of another sequence. If it is, then only the shortest one will be processed. If we want to change that, we will need to allow getting the k-th prefix that matches the input, and pay attention to the return value of gnt_wm_process_input in gntmain.c.
terminfo/termcap doesn't provide all the information that I want to use, eg. ctrl-up, ctrl-down etc. So I am going to hard-code some of the information for some popular $TERMs
This will do stuff with the terminal settings and stuff.
